derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent. (as a term in rhetoric denoting the repetition of words in reverse order): via late Latin from Greek antistrophē, from antistrephein 'turn against', from anti 'against' + strephein 'to turn'

means.word_mean: 1. the section of a choral ode answering a previous strophe in classical Greek drama; the second of two metrically corresponding sections in a poem
